intro: Brachystelma maritae, commonly known as the coastal dudleya, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves that help it survive in arid conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, typically during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
